RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia. Possui Doutorado pela Pontifcia Universidade Catlica do Rio de Janeiro - PUC Rio, Mestrado em Engenharia Eltrica pela Universidade Federal de Itajub - UNIFEI e graduao em Engenharia Eltrica pela Universidade Federal do Maranho - UFMA. Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Eltrica, com nfase em anlises e estudos de Sistemas de Energia.
Atuou como Analista de Pesquisa Energtica, na Empresa de Pesquisa Energtica ? EPE, no planejamento da expanso do sistema eltrico brasileiro. Atuou junto UFES/EBSERH (Universidade Federal do Esprito Santo/Empresa Brasileira de Servios Hospitalares), colaborando no companhamento da manuteno da rede eltrica de mdia e baixa tenso, na elaborao e coordenao de projetos de instalaes eltricas de baixa e mdia tenso, na execuo de obras e na gesto comercia e fiscalizao de contratos de fornecedores. Atualmente professor Adjunto da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco - UFPE, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: microrredes, confiabilidade, integrao de novas fontes de gerao e REDs (sistemas de armazenamento e mobilidade eltrica).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Received the B.Sc. degree from the Federal University of Maranho - UFMA/Brazil, the M.Sc. from UNIFEI/Brazil, in 2014, and the Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering at the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro PUC-Rio. Has experience in Electric Engineering. He is currently a Professor at the Federal University of Pernambuco - UFPE, working mainly on the following topics: microgrids, reliability, integration of new generation sources and REDs (storage systems and electric mobility).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Determinao do Intervalo de Manuteno Programada de Linhas de Transmisso Considerando-se Penalidades Associadas Indisponibilidade
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: As empresas de fornecimento e distribuio de energia eltrica so penalizadas devido indisponibilidade causada por desligamentos programados e no-programados. Atravs da otimizao do intervalo de manuteno dos equipamentos pode-se minimizar essas penalidades. O processo de obteno do intervalo timo de manuteno passa pelos estgios de modelagem e clculo dos indces de confiabilidade do sistema. Ao final do estudo sero gerados recomendaes a serem analisadas e aplicadas na instituio.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de um sistema de Controle Integrado de Gerao para Sistemas Hbridos de Energia Alterantiva Isolados
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Desenvolvimento de um sistema de controle digital para Motor sncrono a ms permanente (permanent magnet synchronous motor ? PMSM) empregando Processador Digital de Sinais (DSP TMS320F2808 da Texas Instruments). Desenvolvimento da placa de interface de potncia para a aquisio de sinais via ADC. Implementao do cdigo-fonte para o controlador digital. O PMSM pode ser empregado para acionar veculos eltricos ou simular geradores elicos.

Sistemas de gerao de energia de energia eltrica atravs fontes renovveis necessitam de sistemas eletromecnicos precisos e eficientes. Neste intuito a gerao elica pode ser obtida utilizando-se mquinas sncronas ma permanente controladas por processadores de sinais. O alto desempenho deste tipo de mquina associado adequadas tcnicas de controle demonstra ser uma alternativa promissora para o desenvolvimento de sistemas de gerao que utilizam fontes escassas tais como a energia renovvel elica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PD-0397-3026/2017 - Insero de Sistema de Armazenamento em Configuraes Mltiplas para Suporte Gerao Elica
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
PD-0397-3026/2017 - "Insero de Sistema de Armazenamento em Configuraes Mltiplas para Suporte Gerao Elica".

O projeto parte da chamada estratgica 0021/2016, focada na aplicao de projetos piloto de sistemas de armazenamento de energia.

O objetivo do projeto em questo avaliar, dimensionar e aplicar sistema de armazenamento de energia em centrais elicas.

A possibilidade da reduo de problemas tcnicos com a utilizao do armazenamento de energia um item promissor para a operao de sistemas elicos e, consequentemente, para o sistema eltrico como um todo. Alm de permitir um suporte de tenso (resultando em reduo nos problemas de nvel de tenso em regime permanente, dinmico e transitrio), possvel implantar um sistema de armazenamento de energia (ESS ? Energy Storage System) para diminuir a variabilidade da produo elica, ?suavizando? a potncia gerada, assim como, o problema de ?rampa" (taxa de variao da produo de grande bloco de centrais elicas).

Os resultados do projeto sero insumo para elaborao de propostas de normas tcnicas, ajustes regulatrios e novos modelos de negcio.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PD-00063-3058/2019: Merge - Desenvolvimento de Microrredes Eficientes, Confiveis e Sustentveis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto MERGE (Microgrids for Efficient, Reliable and GreenerEnergy) busca desenvolver conhecimento para antecipar oportunidades,enfrentar ameaas e gerar valor agregado atravs da implantao deaplicaes reais de microrredes no Brasil. Como objetivos do projeto, temos:Desenvolvimento, teste e implementaes de microrredes nos modos normal(conectado) e de emergncia (ilhado) por longos perodo e/ou em casoscrticos, suprindo as cargas de maior prioridade; Integrao com a rede paraaumentar a eficincia, confiabilidade, qualidade de energia e servio e parareduo de emisses de gases de efeito estufa; Teste de diferentes tecnologiase mtodos de controle, fornecimento e armazenamento usando simulaes etestes de laboratrio antes de aplicaes em campo; Realizao de estudospara contribuir com o modelo regulatrio para microrredes, alm deproposies normativas de operao e padres de segurana;Desenvolvimento e estudos de modelos econmicos e sistemas tarifrios paraviabilidade econmica de novos negcios em microrredes; Proposio deestratgias de segurana ciberntica para proteger os sistemas de superviso,controle e telecomunicaes das microrredes...

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medio, Controle, Correo e Proteo de Sistemas Eltricos de Potncia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Optimal filter design considering the system uncertain behavior has been a topic of research for a long time. Due to the lower cost, passive filters are still considered the most common solution for harmonic distortion problems. This paper presents a heuristic methodology for the placement and sizing of passive filters through ranking solutions based on the standard quality index THD (Total Harmonic Distortion). The developed method was implemented and applied to a simplified test system. The results showed that it is possible to mitigate harmonic distortion using a distributed approach during the filter selection. Additionally, since the method is mainly based in a heurist approach, it avoids the complexity associated with of use of advanced mathematical tools and artificial intelligence techniques. The analyses contemplate the condition with background distortion.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This work proposes a new method for obtaining equipment ranking lists, which can be used in state enumeration algorithms to evaluate the reliability of generation and transmission (G&T) systems. The proposed approach is based on the variance reduction technique named Importance Sampling (IS). Concepts from IS, a tool aimed at sampling processes, such as Monte Carlo simulation, are used to rank the most relevant equipment in a G&T system. The proposed tool is applied to a modified version of the 1979 IEEE-RTS test system and the obtained results are discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um dos desafios enfrentados pelas concessionrias de distribuio para viabilizar a conexo e operao de Microrredes a ausncia de um conjunto slido de normas tcnicas no pas. Uma alternativa tem sido utilizar e adaptar os padres existentes aplicados para micro e minigerao distribuda. Nesse contexto, este informe tcnico apresenta uma anlise do status de desenvolvimento de normas, padres e requisitos gerais de conexo e operao de microrredes, bem como uma proposta de normatizao e estruturao de requisitos tcnicos e operacionais relativos implantao de projetos de microrredes no Brasil.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta o impacto de sistemas de armazenamento de energia com baterias (BESS) na mitigao dos efeitos dos desligamentos das linhas de transmisso que interligam as subestaes de Goianinha, Santa Rita II, Norfil e Mussur II, todas pertencentes a zona Leste da regio Nordeste. O BESS pode assumir papel estratgico na manuteno da segurana do servio de carga dessas subestaes. Foi analisado o comportamento do sistema para o cenrio de contingncia na LT Goianinha / Santa Rita II durante a interveno da LT Santa Rita II / Pau Ferro. Com ferramentas de anlise como monitoramento de desigualdades e despacho controlado do BESS, possvel evitar a sobrecarga da LT Goianinha / Norfil decorrente do cenrio de indisponibilidade das LTs Goianinha / Santa Rita II e Santa Rita II / Pau Ferro. Ainda, foi realizada uma estimativa da diferena de custo operacional do BESS em relao gerao trmica.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo avalia o emprego de sistemas de armazenamento de energia integrados gerao solar fotovoltaica, para incrementar a flexibilidade operativa e mitigar restries de transmisso, devido limitada capacidade de despacho do Sistema Interligado Nacional, frente alta penetrao de fontes renovveis de energia. Para a avaliao tcnica utilizado um estudo de caso, desenvolvido no mbito do projeto de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento 021/2016 da Agncia Nacional de Energia Eltrica, da real prospeco de conexo ao SIN de trs usinas fotovoltaicas, que agregam 2 GW ao sistema eltrico nacional, e que devido a restries operativas da regio eltrica de interesse, podem ter seu despacho restringido pelo operador. desenvolvida uma anlise de fluxo de potncia com a implantao do sistema de armazenamento em baterias, devidamente modelado, considerando o cenrio mais crtico, para verificar se essa tecnologia mitiga as restries de transmisso, permitindo o despacho completo das novas fontes. As anlises so feitas atravs do software Anlise de Redes Eltricas, de propriedade do Centro de Pesquisas de Energia Eltrica, utilizando a base de dados disponibilizada pelo Operador Nacional do Sistema.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXVII Seminrio Nacional de Produo e Transmisso de Energia Eltrica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nos ltimos anos tem sido observada a insero significativa de veculos eltricos (VE) nas frotas urbanas. Como consequncia, carregadores ou estaes de recarga rpida (ERR) para VE com conexo na rede de distribuio tem se proliferado. As ERR, em funo da dinmica de fornecimento de potncia, podem provocar impactos no ponto de conexo. Neste sentido, importante para as concessionrias e gestores de unidades consumidoras uma avaliao preliminar das condicionantes para a ocorrncia de violao dos limites de qualidade. Neste contexto, este artigo descreve o desenvolvimento de um indicador de impacto eltrico que avalia os parmetros que influenciam a rede eltrica durante o carregamento de veculos eltricos. O trabalho apresenta modelos de simulaes utilizados para identificar e incorporar ao indicador os principais fatores de relevncia, tal como como demanda de potncia, potncia de curto-circuito, distoro harmnica e fator de potncia. A utilizao de simulaes permite a avaliao de pontos de operao crticos. Os resultados obtidos destacaram a importncia de considerar esses parmetros para garantir um carregamento eficaz e seguro dos veculos eltricos. O indicador de impacto eltrico proposto oferece uma ferramenta para gesto de redes eltricas, viabilizando uma avaliao preditiva do impacto do carregamento de VE, possibilitando a adoo de medidas adequadas para garantir a manuteno da operao das redes de distribuio acessadas por estaes de recarga.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: AVALIAO DE ALTERNATIVAS PARA ADEQUAO DA SE BONGI CONSIDERANDO SISTEMA DE ARMAZENAMENTO POR BATERIAS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXVII Seminrio Nacional de Produo e Transmisso de Energia Eltrica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo contempla um estudo de avaliao de alternativas de atendimento e adequao de instalao de Rede Bsica da regio metropolitana de Recife/PE, a subestao (SE) Bongi, integrante do Sistema Interligado Nacional (SIN). As anlises consideram o carregamento ? em operao normal e em contingncia ? a fim de identificar possveis violaes sistmicas e indicam que, apesar de serem previstas obras a nvel de transmisso ainda h necessidade de uma adequao topolgica entre os setores de 69 e 230 kV a partir do horizonte de 2028. Neste sentido, alm das solues convencionais, avaliada a utilizao de um Sistema de Armazenamento de Energia (SAE) para a composio de uma VPL (Virtual Power Line) do lado da demanda (ou NWA ? Non Wire Transmission Alternative). O trabalho descreve as estratgias para estimar os requisitos de potncia e energia requerida para o sistema de armazenamento, bem como as simulaes da operao considerando perda simples de equipamentos (N-1) e atendimento aos picos de demanda.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: GERAO SOLAR FOTOVOLTAICA E HIDROGNIO VERDE INTEGRADOS EM PLANTA INDUSTRIAL PARA SUPRIMENTO DOS SERVIOS DE SUBESTAO DE CONEXO DE USINA TERMOELTRICA

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXVII Seminrio Nacional de Produo e Transmisso de Energia Eltrica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A produo e utilizao do hidrognio verde (H2V) gerado a partir de gerao renovvel em aplicaes no setor eltrico brasileiro tem sido alvo de intensa investigao nos ltimos anos. Um dos desafios da cadeia de produo do hidrognio buscar uma destinao adequada do H2V, considerando custos competitivos no contexto global do setor eletroenergtico e de combustveis. Neste sentido, o projeto H2Green prope o desenvolvimento de estruturas conceituais para avaliao do emprego do hidrognio produzido a partir de gerao solar fotovoltaica em uma estrutura multipropsito, como recurso de suporte operao eltrica e gerenciamento trmico de usina termoeltrica e subestao de conexo. Este Informe Tcnico revisita aspectos associados a eletrolisadores e Clula Combustvel (CaC), apresenta a ideia geral do projeto H2Green e as aplicaes prospectadas e, por fim, apresenta o dimensionamento do sistema de gerao para suprimento planta de produo de H2V.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Avaliao Probabilstica da Reserva Operativa em Sistemas Elicos Hbridos com Armazenamento de Energia na Presena de Veculos Eltricos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXIII Congresso Brasileiro de Automtica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo avalia o uso de tecnologias de armazenamento de energia integrado gerao elica para aumentar a reserva operativa de sistemas de energia eltrica, a fim de melhorar a operao de curto prazo e reduzir o risco de interrupo da carga. Os nveis de reserva girante, necessrios para garantir a confiabilidade do sistema, so avaliados por meio de ndices de risco estimados pelo mtodo de simulao Monte Carlo e tcnicas de Entropia Cruzada (CE - Cross-Entropy). A insero de veculos eltricos na rede eltrica representada como incerteza no modelo de carga de curto prazo. O mtodo proposto aplicado ao sistema IEEE-RTS-Wind e os resultados correspondentes so adequadamente discutidos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper evaluates the use of energy storage systems integrated to wind generation to increase the operating reserve of an electrical power network, in order to improve the short-term operation and reduce the risk of load interruption. The spinning reserve levels, which are required to ensure the system reliability, are assessed through risk indices evaluated using Monte Carlo simulation and cross-entropy method. Electrical vehicles insertion in the power network is represented as uncertainties in the short-term load model. The proposed method is applied to the IEEE-RTS-Wind system and the corresponding results are suitably discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract
The energy transition towards a low-emission matrix has motivated efforts to reduce the use of fossil fuels in the transportation sector. The growth of the electric mobility market has been consistent in recent years. In Brazil, there has been an accelerated growth in the sales rate of new electric (and hybrid) vehicles (EVs). Fiscal incentives provided by governments, along with the reduction in vehicle costs, are factors contributing to the exponential growth of the EV fleet?creating a favorable environment for the dissemination of new technologies and enabling the participation of players from sectors such as battery manufacturing and charging stations. Considering the international context, the E-Lounge R&D joint initiative aims to evaluate different strategies to economically enable the electric mobility market, exploring EV charging service sales by energy distribution utility companies in Brazil. This work describes the step-by-step development of an ideal model of a charging hub and discusses its operation based on a real deployment, as well as its associated technical and economic feasibility. Using EV charging data based on the E-Lounge?s operational behavior, an artificial neural network (ANN) is applied to forecast future energy consumption to each EV charging station. This paper also presents an economic analysis of the E-Lounge case study, which can contribute to proposals for electric vehicle charging ecosystems in the context of smart energy systems. Based on the operational results collected, as well as considering equipment usage projections, it is possible to make EV charging enterprises feasible, even when high investments in infrastructure and equipment (charging stations and battery storage systems) are necessary, since the net present value is positive and the payback period is 4 years. This work contributes by presenting real operational data from a charging hub, a projection model aimed at evaluating future operations, and a realis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The electric distribution sector is facing significant challenges in integrating distributed energy resources (DERs), with mostassessment methodologies being primarily tested on standard feeders. However, given the nature of electric distributionsystems, each feeder is unique and constantly changing, emphasizing the need for customized and updated feeder models forlocal quantitative studies. These studies encompass network operation, expansion planning, and DER integration. In responseto this context, this paper proposes a methodology for extracting and processing information from public data to modelup-to-date electric feeders. As these feeder models represent real operating circuits, they can be utilized by utilities, investors,and consumers. The proposed approach involves processing data from the Brazilian utilities? geographic database (BDGD,in Portuguese) to develop structured simulations of distribution feeders using OpenDSS software. The BDGD standardsare established by the Brazilian National Electric Energy Agency (ANEEL). In order to validate the methodology, two casestudies are presented evaluating the impacts of distributed generation on real feeders from the Brazilian utilities: Minas GeraisElectric Power Company (CEMIG) and Bahia State Electricity Company (Neoenergia COELBA).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An Analysis of the Limitations of Power Smoothing Metrics and Future Perspectives for Their Evolution in the Context of BESS-Based Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: An Analysis of the Limitations of Power Smoothing Metrics and Future Perspectives for Their Evolution in the Context of BESS-Based Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The growing presence of power ramps, typically caused by the intermittency of renewable energy sources (RESs), may ultimately threaten the stability and reliability of the power grid. In the context of power smoothing algorithms such as Moving Average, Ramp Rate and First-Order Low-Pass Filter have been widely used in reference generation for Energy Storage Systems (ESSs). In this scenario, this paper analyzes typical metrics used for evaluating power smoothing techniques and comments on their limitations. Validation of this analysis is conducted using PV generation data sourced from the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL). The results highlight the need to develop new metrics for a fairier comparison. Finally, this work also sets a concrete path for the evolution of said metrics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Assessment of Green Hydrogen as Energy Supply Alternative for Isolated Power Systems and Microgrids
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Assessment of Green Hydrogen as Energy Supply Alternative for Isolated Power Systems and Microgrids

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The energy supply for isolated systems remains a current challenge in Brazil and worldwide, particularly when known solutions are compared regarding their cost, ability to supply energy on demand, and sustainability. In this context, green hydrogen, which has been considered one
of the main paths for the decarbonization of the energy chain, is also seen as a potential energy
supply solution in isolated systems. Based on a literature review of articles addressing the topics of green hydrogen and isolated systems, an analysis is conducted on the application of green hydrogen as an energy supply solution for isolated systems. The review identified and collected data on important parameters for comparing solutions, such as CAPEX, OPEX, energy cost, and the price per kilogram of hydrogen. Using these data, analyses were performed to provide an overview of the application of green hydrogen in isolated systems. One of the objectives of this work is to present a comprehensive analysis of the green hydrogen chain and its application in the context of electricity generation, particularly for isolated systems in Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Assessment of Electric Vehicles Charging Grid Impact via Predictive Indicator

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In recent years, the integration of electric vehicles (EV) into urban fleets has seen a significant rise, leading to a considerable increase in the number of EV chargers and fast charging stations (FCS) connected to distribution networks. Depending on the characteristics of the electrical power system, such as short-circuit power and voltage harmonic distortion, due to the dynamic operation during charging sessions, EV charging stations may impacts the quality of power in the connection point. As a result, it is crucial for utility companies and facility managers to perform preliminary assessments to identify potential exceedances of quality limits.In this context, this work describes the development of an electrical grid impact indicator that evaluates the parameters that influence the electrical network during charging of electric vehicles. A case study and a simulation model were used to identify and incorporate into the indice the main relevant factors, such as power demand, short-circuit power, harmonic distortion, and power factor. The simulation models were employed to evaluate critical operational points, and measurement data further validated the model?s performance. The results highlighted the importance of considering these parameters to ensure effective and safe recharging of electric vehicles. The proposed electrical impact indicator offers an electrical network management tool, allowing a predictive assessment of the impact of EV charging and enabling the adoption of appropriate measures to ensure the quality of power of the distribution networks accessed by charging stations.

Recursos Energticos Distribudos REDs - Distributed Energy Resources DERs - Nota Tcnica EPE - Documento de Apoio ao PNE 2050 - Estudos de Longo Prazo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Recursos Energticos Distribudos (RED, ou Distributed Energy Resources ? DER em ingls) so definidos como tecnologias de gerao e/ou armazenamento de energia eltrica, localizados dentro dos limites da rea de uma determinada concessionria de distribuio, normalmente junto a unidades consumidoras, atrs do medidor (behindthe-meter). Adicionalmente, com frequncia essa definio vem se ampliando para abarcar aind eficincia energtica, resposta da demanda (RD) e gerenciamento pelo lado da demanda (GLD). Assim, com o intuito de identificar as implicaes da penetrao em larga escala dessas tecnologias no sistema eltrico, consideraremos aqui que os RED contemplam: i) gerao distribuda (GD), ii) armazenamento de energia, iii) veculos eltricos (VE) e estrutura de recarga, iv) eficincia energtica e v) resposta da demanda (RD) (FGV, 2016). Nesses termos, os RED permitem a maior participao do
consumidor tanto na gerao, quanto na gesto do consumo da sua prpria energia.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DO-ORIENTADO: ANDR VICTOR RODRIGUES NASCIMENTO DA SILVA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This study addresses the application of a hybrid deterministic and stochastic
methodology to quantify constrained-off events in Variable Renewable Energy (VRE) sources,
particularly wind and solar, and its application in a case study on the Sistema Interligado
Nacional (SIN) for the year 2025. Through the integration of deterministic analyses, which
include power flow simulations using the Newton?Raphson method, and stochastic analyses
that evaluate the variable behavior of demand and generation, the study provides a detailed
assessment of the impacts of significant renewable energy capacities integration into the power
grid. The analyzed scenarios, with installed capacities of 47.7 GW and 77.7 GW of VRE,
projected generation cuts of 1.8% and 19.4% of renewable energy from these sources,
respectively, with cuts of 6.1% and 28.7% of renewable energy from these sources in
September, the highest constrained-off month. The research highlights the need for
improvements in transmission infrastructure and the implementation of storage technologies to
mitigate the adverse effects of constrained-off events. Additionally, the need for adaptive
energy policies that can facilitate an efficient transition to a more sustainable and resilient
energy system is discussed. The results indicate that, without significant infrastructure
improvements and proper load management, constrained-off events may become more frequent
and intense, compromising the stability and efficiency of the power system, the economic
sustainability of generation projects, and new investments in renewables.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Avaliao da Operao de Eletroposto de Recarga Rpida e Simulao dos Impactos de Conexo

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Wind Power, High-Frequency Fluctuation, Mitigation, Turbine Aggregation, PSD, BESS.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DO-CURSO: Programa de Ps-Graduao em Engenharia Eltrica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This work offers a bibliographic review and characterization of high-frequency fluctuations in
measurements from a real wind farm of 51 turbines, of which 36 are DFIG and 15 are DD. The
characterization is performed using the power spectral density (PSD), highlighting the persistence
of high-frequency fluctuations, especially np ones, despite the technological advancements in
wind turbines. A methodology was developed to investigate the potential reduction of these
fluctuations through the aggregation of turbines of different technologies in various quantities.
However, the results suggest that there is no significant difference in the reduction of fluctuations,
regardless of the park?s turbine composition. Additionally, a limit was identified in the number
of aggregated turbines, present in all tested compositions, beyond which there is no significant
impact on reducing high-frequency fluctuations. To further improve the mitigation of these
fluctuations, a platform focused on reducing both global and high-frequency fluctuations was
created. It was demonstrated that it is possible to completely mitigate high-frequency fluctuations
with an appropriately sized Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) using a power smoothing
strategy based on moving averages. The platform also assisted in the BESS sizing, highlighting
the importance of adjusting the nominal power and smoothing range according to the specific
mitigation needs, whether eliminating global, np fluctuations, or both.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Keywords: Smart Grids. Microgrids. Smartmeter. Web Application. Remote Monitoring. Energy Management.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
A smart grid is a new type of network under development, which allows unconventional power flow and bidirectional information flow. In other words, it is essential for
implementing an automatic and distributed energy delivery network. A microgrid is a
controllable system composed of a grouping of loads and distributed energy resources,
including generation and storage technologies. This system operates by providing energy
in an integrated manner within the limits of a distribution utility area. In this context, it
is necessary to intelligently monitor and manage these resources to promote efficiency and
quality in energy supply. This work consists of the design of a bidirectional smart energy
meter and a web monitoring and management platform applied to microgrids. Therefore, a device was produced that measures electrical parameters such as voltage, current,
consumption, production, power factor, among others, and sends real-time data via the
internet for cloud storage. Additionally, a web application was developed to display the
collected information and thus allow microgrid management. In this way, it is possible to
monitor consumption and generation, as well as obtain the system parameter history for
more complex analyses.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: CONTROLE E SUPERVISO DE UMA ESTAO DE RECARGA DE VECULOS ELTRICOS: APLICAO DO PROTOCOLO OCPP
Avaliao de estratgias para comercializao da produo de sistemas de gerao solar fotovoltaica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo
Em funo do elevado potencial para explorao da energia solar fotovoltaica encontrado no
territrio brasileiro, na ltima dcada houve um crescimento significativo da participao das
usinas solares centralizadas na Matriz Eltrica do Brasil. O fenmeno da disseminao desta
fonte renovvel tambm foi observado em diversos outros pases. Este movimento do setor
eltrico foi possvel tambm por conta dos incentivos e benefcios concedidos fonte solar a
partir da dcada de 90. Diante do contexto de uma possvel interrupo de subsdios iminente,
os preos praticados atualmente por este mercado podem vir a no apresentar mais viabilidade
financeira, fazendo-se necessria uma anlise destes projetos com vistas a entender como a
fonte solar pode continuar ocupando um espao crescente na matriz eletroenergtica do pas,
garantindo retorno financeiro aos seus investidores por meio da adoo das estratgias
adequadas para comercializao da eletricidade gerada. Com esta finalidade, este trabalho
apresenta uma comparao dos indicadores de retorno financeiro obtidos com a comercializao
da energia gerada por uma usina solar fotovoltaica (UFV) centralizada em diferentes cenrios,
considerando o enquadramento do projeto no contexto do ACL (Ambiente de Contratao Livre)
e do ACR (Ambiente de Contratao Regulada).
Palavras-chave: Usina Solar Fotovoltaica; Gerao Centralizada; Setor Eltrico Brasileiro;
Comercializao de Energia; Energia Renovvel

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Metodologia de clculo da margem de transmisso visando subsidiar leiles de energia

DETALHAMENTO-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-DE.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Algumas modalidades de leiles de energia utilizam o conceito de margem de transmisso visando coordenar a gerao contratada com a rede existente na data de incio de entrega da energia. Nesses leiles so impostos limites contratao de energia na rede eltrica de acordo com a margem de escoamento disponvel. Assim, atenua-se o descompasso entre algumas obras de transmisso recomendadas para acomodar gerao adicional no sistema eltrico, em um arcabouo de incertezas na localizao de geraes futuras, especialmente fontes alternativas. Esse trabalho discute as condicionantes que envolvem o clculo de margens de transmisso, prope e aplica uma metodologia baseada em abordagem probabilstica, mtricas de baixa expectncia de rejeio de gerao, fluxo de potncia CA e tcnicas de otimizao, sob a considerao de elevado nmero de cenrios horrios de operao. Na etapa inicial, as margens so obtidas com a aplicao da metodologia em um sistema teste e outro de grande porte e comparadas com abordagens clssicas baseadas em cenrios reduzidos e em mtricas conservadoras. Na etapa final, realizado um protocolo de leilo cujas restries de rede so impostas pelas margens calculadas na primeira etapa. Os resultados das simulaes evidenciam a possibilidade de contratao de fontes mais baratas e competitivas em pontos do sistema eltrico com recursos energticos de alta qualidade, decorrentes de possveis aumentos das margens de escoamento, preservando ainda uma operao confivel e adequada da rede de transmisso.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Energy storage systems, renewable energy, batteries, sizing, optimization.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Devido s recentes mudanas na matriz eltrica brasileira, com maior participao de usinas de gerao renovvel intermitente e menor capacidade de armazenamento de energia nos reservatrios das usinas hidrulicas em relao carga, novos desafios tm se apresentado na operao do Sistema Interligado Nacional (SIN). Visando a mitigao das dificuldades impostas pelo novo cenrio vivenciado, o uso de tecnologias alternativas vem sendo estudado, dentre as quais destacam-se os sistemas de armazenamento de energia, como baterias, em funo de sua versatilidade, velocidade de resposta, flexibilidade operativa e relativamente rpida instalao. Entretanto, em razo do alto custo dessa tecnologia, estudos devem ser realizados para aproveitar ao mximo seu potencial, buscando o dimensionamento timo do sistema de armazenamento. Com este objetivo, o trabalho atual apresenta uma proposta de metodologia para dimensionamento de sistemas de armazenamento em larga escala, para viabilizao do escoamento da gerao renovvel intermitente conectada rede de transmisso.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Due to the recent changes to the Brazilian total primary energy supply, with higher penetration of renewable sources and lower energy storage capacity in the hydroelectric reservoirs when compared to the demand, new challenges have been presenting themselves regarding the operation of the National Interconnected System. Aiming the attenuation of the difficulties imposed by the new scenario, the utilization of alternative technologies has been widely studied, among which the energy storage systems, such as batteries, have lately gained notoriety by virtue of its versatility, quick response time, operational flexibility and relatively fast installation. However, because of the high cost associated with the technology, a few studies must be conducted to utilize its full potential, by investigating the optimal sizing of the energy storage system. In that regard, this study presents a methodology proposal to size energy storage systems in large scale, to enable the penetration of renewable energy sources connected to the electrical power transmission system.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: PLANEJAMENTO DA MANUTENO DA GERAO CONSIDERANDO MERCADO DESCENTRALIZADO E FONTES RENOVVEIS

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Aplicaes de Aprendizado de Mquina na Deteco de Anomalias em Sistemas Elicos

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Machine learning. Fault detection. Predictive anal

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In this work, a methodology focused on identifying anomalies in wind turbines is
presented, aiming to anticipate temperature variations in critical machine components.
The elements subjected to analysis include the gearbox bearing and the drive-end bearing
of the generator. The study is based on modeling and applying machine learning algorithms with the goal of predicting the temperature in these components. The employed
regression algorithms encompass linear multiple regression, extreme gradient boosting,
and a recurrent neural network called long short-term memory. For modeling these techniques, data from the supervision system of three wind turbines in a Brazilian wind farm
consisting of twelve machines are utilized. Machines were chosen with distinct temperature
behaviors to assess potential variations in the performance of learning models in the face
of diverse thermal behaviors. The machine data undergo a preprocessing stage to identify
outliers from the normal operation of wind turbines. Subsequently, the data is divided
into specific sets for algorithm application. In the case of the extreme gradient boosting
model, a Bayesian optimization technique was employed to find optimal parameters that
suit the proposed dataset. The results of the regression algorithms are analyzed in terms
of performance metrics, and comparisons between actual and predicted temperatures are
conducted within defined control limits, aiming to identify anomalies in the temperature
of the studied elements. Finally, the models applied to the three machines are compared
for each analyzed component. The main advantages of this model include its ability to
provide excellent results for complex prediction problems, low financial implementation
costs, and high adaptability for implementation in other machines

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Variabilidade de Potncia em Gerao Fotovoltaica: Mtodos de Suavizao, Mtricas e Caracterizao

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fontes Renovveis e Tecnologias de Armazenamento

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Human-induced climate change, primarily caused by greenhouse gas emissions, poses a significant threat to the sustainability of life on Earth. To mitigate this problem, renewable energy
sources (RESs), such as photovoltaic (PV) and wind generation, have gained substantial relevance
as economically viable alternatives. Recent price drops in these technologies have accelerated
their adoption as significant contributors to countries? power grids. Although relatively clean,
these alternatives are not free of negative impacts, particularly concerning their integration
into power grids. Literature reports highlight issues such as voltage flickers, frequency deviations, and the need for larger power reserves, all stemming from the hard-to-anticipate nature
of power variability. In the described scenario, this study addresses one of these impacts: the
increase in power variability, with an emphasis on the use of energy storage systems in AC
microgrids aimed at power smoothing. The literature review highlights works that tackle the
issue of power variability, methods for generating reference signals for power smoothing, and
the characterization of variability through probability density functions, providing theoretical
support for the evaluation of current metrics and the proposal of alternatives. In this context, a set
of experimental data from the NREL (National Renewable Energy Laboratory) is used, exposing
the limitations of commonly used metrics to assess reference signal generation methods for
power smoothing. Also, based on the data, an assessment of power variability characterization
methods is conducted, employing a subset of the most common methods in the literature. Given
the limitations found in this study, new metrics are developed, drawing on best practices from
the field of Statistics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: GERENCIAMENTO DE CLULA DE COMBUSTVEL EM MICRORREDE OPERANDO NO MODO ILHADO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The current scenario in the energy system is driven by the insertion of
Distributed Energy Resources (DER), which include Distributed Generation (DG) and
Energy Storage Systems (ESS). In this context, a potential alternative for integrating
DER with the electrical system are microgrids. The microgrid (MG) is capable of
providing better reliability for system operation due to its plug-and-play characteristic,
that is, the ability to operate in connected and disconnected modes from the main grid.
For the microgrid to be capable to provide support for the integration of DERs, it is
essential to have the presence of an energy management system (EMS), responsible
for managing the energy resources that is part of the MG. With energy management,
it is possible to guarantee the dispatch of each energy resource considering its
restrictions, in addition to meeting any request associated with an operational or
economic requirement. Aiming to evaluate the performance of the EMS on a MG, this
work proposes to evaluate EMS strategies in an MG disconnected from the main grid,
composed by a diesel generator, fuel cell (FC), battery energy storage system (BESS)
and photovoltaic (PV) generation system. Therefore, the work considers two energy
management strategies: state machine and fuzzy logic, implemented using the
Matlab/Simulink computational tool. The objective of the strategies is to dispatch each
MG energy resource when there is any disturbance associated with variations in
generation or load. Furthermore, the strategies aim to operate the FC in the region of
best efficiency with the support of BESS. Finally, based on the results operating the
FC in the region of best efficiency reduces the consumption of oxygen and hydrogen
and improves the voltage profile of the DC bus.

Keywords: distributed energy resources, microgrids, fuel cell, battery storage system,
state machine, fuzzy logic.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: AVALIAO DA OPERAO E DOS IMPACTOS ELTRICOS DA CONEXO DE ELETROPOSTO DE RECARGA RPIDA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The present study aims to conduct a comprehensive analysis of the challenges faced by
urban electrical grids in the face of the massive charging of electric vehicles (EVs). In the
current context of a society constantly focused on seeking sustainable solutions, electric
mobility emerges as a promising alternative to mitigate greenhouse gas emissions and reduce
dependence on fossil fuels.
In the current scenario of electric mobility, the growing interest in electric vehicles as a
viable response to environmental and energy challenges is evident. The increasing demand
necessitates the need to manage the implications of massive EV charging on urban networks.
In this context, this work describes the challenges related to electric mobility and its
repercussions on urban electrical infrastructures, specifically associated with electrical impacts
on power quality resulting from the connection of EVs to the grid.
The results are based on simulations implemented in a Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL)
environment, highlighting operating points and conditions for the occurrence of electrical
impacts from fast charging stations on the power quality components established by the
PRODIST standard (Electricity Distribution Procedure). Finally, a new specific indicator is
proposed, called the Electric Vehicle Charging Grid Impact Index (ECGII).
The goal of the ECGII is to predictively assess, in stages prior to the installation of a
new charger connected to the distribution network, the potential occurrence of impacts from
EV charging. Thus, the ECGII index can be a tool for urban electrical network managers and
planners, serving as a classifier to support strategies that optimize vehicle integration, ensuring
energy efficiency and operational reliability. Therefore, in the context of the growing adoption
of electric mobility, this work seeks to contribute with a method to support the management of
challenges faced by urban electrical grids in scenarios of high inser

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Em geral, as subestaes so projetadas com transformadores em paralelo,
operando a meia carga, para assegurar continuidade no fornecimento de energia
mesmo que um transformador do grupo falhe. Contudo, essa prtica implica em
custos elevados, especialmente no que diz respeito ao arranjo de subestaes.
Uma soluo alternativa a utilizao de estoques compartilhados de transformadores reservas e unidades de subestaes mveis, que devem atender a um grupo
de subestaes com as mesmas caractersticas eltricas. Neste contexto, esta tese
prope a utilizao temporria de unidades de subestaes mveis, que devem
atuar para atender demanda de energia enquanto o transformador reserva instalado. Essa estratgia aumenta a confiabilidade do sistema e reduz os custos operacionais e de investimento para as concessionrias de energia. No entanto, o sucesso dessa abordagem est intrinsecamente ligado ao dimensionamento e localiza-
o adequada dos estoques. Para que bons resultados sejam alcanados, preciso
dimensionar os estoques de forma que no haja investimento desnecessrio ou um
nmero insuficiente de equipamentos, e considerar pontos estratgicos de armazenamento, de forma que o tempo de deslocamento dos equipamentos sobressalentes at o ponto de falha garanta a minimizao dos custos associados. Posto isso,
esta tese apresenta duas metodologias para otimizao de dimensionamento e respectiva localizao dos seus estoques de transformadores reservas e unidades de
subestaes mveis via simulao Monte Carlo e Algoritmo Gentico. Ambos os
mtodos foram aplicados a um grupo de transformadores de duas concessionrias
reais, visando demonstrar a capacidade da metodologia de encontrar um conjunto
de solues factveis do ponto de vista tcnico e econmico.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In general, substations are designed with transformers in parallel, operating
at half load, to ensure continuity of power supply even if a transformer in the
group fails. However, this practice involves high costs, especially with regard to
the arrangement of substations. An alternative solution is the use of shared stocks
of reserve transformers and mobile substation units, which must serve a group of
substations with the same electrical characteristics. In this context, this thesis proposes the temporary use of mobile substation units, which must act to meet the
energy demand while the reserve transformer is installed. This strategy increases
system reliability and reduces operational and investment costs for electric utilities. However, the success of this approach is intrinsically linked to the proper
sizing and location of stocks. For good results to be achieved, it is necessary to
size stocks so that there is no unnecessary investment or an insufficient number of
equipment, and consider strategic storage points, so that the time taken to move
the spare equipment to the point of failure minimizes the associated costs. Thus,
this thesis presents two approaches for optimizing the sizing and respective location of stocks of spare transformers and mobile substations via Monte Carlo simulation and genetic algorithm. Both methods were applied to a group of transformers from two real utilities, aiming at proving the method's ability to find a set of
feasible solutions from a technical and economic point of view.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Avaliao da Confiabilidade de Sistemas de Distribuio com Insero de Gerao Distribuda via Tcnicas de Simulao de Monte Carlo
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Reliability Assessment of Distribution Systems with Insertion of Distributed Generation via Monte Carlo Simulation Techniques

DETALHAMENTO-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-DE.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Pontifcia Universidade Catlica do Rio de Janeiro

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Avaliao da confiabilidade; fontes renovveis; ge

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Renewable sources are important resources to be added to electrical energy
systems in favor of decentralized generation. Discussions about environmental effects drive the studies in search of alternatives that make it possible to minimize the
emission of polluting gases and diversify the electrical matrix. In this context, distributed generation (DG) of a renewable nature has been increasingly present,
changing the classic structure of the system and giving greater engagement to the
consumer. Therefore, it is essential to evaluate the performance of these new distribution grids in meeting the power demand, in order to establish appropriate standards and monitor them through the regulatory agencies. There is a diversity of methods for evaluating the performance of these networks, mainly through reliability
concepts, to deal with equipment failures and the resulting effects. This thesis aims
to evaluate reliability indices of distribution systems in the presence of DG. To this
end, three techniques based on Monte Carlo simulation (MCS) are presented. A
classic one, called sequential MCS, aims at modeling the chronological nature of
the problem as well as the uncertainties arising from the intermittency of the DG
sources. The second one is based on a quasi-sequential MCS, is characterized by its
simplicity and ability to maintain the flexibility of sequential MCS, but with better
performance in terms of precision and processing time. Finally, an MCS based on
the concepts of chronological system state transition, also provides precision and
flexibility to the reliability assessment. New testing functions are proposed to
achieve this goal. Two systems with DG insertion are used to evaluate the performance of the proposed concepts and techniques: IEEE RBTS, a standard academic
network widely used in the area of reliability; and another real network. The exhaustive discussion of the results confirms that both proposals meet the established
objectives.

Manso, Bruno Alves de S; Leite da Silva, Armando Martins (Advisor); Castro, Andr Milhorance de (Co-Advisor). Generation and Transmission System Reliability Assessment via Monte Carlo Simulation Optimized by
Variance Reduction Techniques and Computer Intelligence. Rio de
Janeiro, 2023. 99p. Doctorate Thesis Proposal ? Department of Electrical Engineering, Pontific Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro.
Monte Carlo simulation (MCS) is an efficient tool in the reliability analysis
of large composite generation and transmission systems. In practice, however, planners take greater interest in evaluating only their operating regions, especially areas
and buses where there is a greater concentration of consumers. In this case, supply
failure (i.e., load shedding) is often a rare event, which substantially increases the
computational cost of the MCS. To deal with this situation, the use of variance reduction techniques was proposed in numerous works, which present good results,
but still find some difficulty in modeling the physical restrictions of the transmission network. Computational intelligence techniques have also been employed in
order to increase the efficiency of composite reliability algorithms. Pattern recognition approach encompasses most of these techniques. Generally, its task is to directly reduce the execution of state adequacy analysis through classifiers. Such classifiers need to be ?trained? from samples with good representation of the failure,
which restricts its application, given that the failure of interest of system agents is,
in general, a rare event. In this work, a new application of the importance sampling
technique, via cross-entropy method, that adequately models transmission network
restrictions, is proposed. Additionally, seeking to further increase the tool?s performance, it is proposed to couple a state classifier in order to differentiate states between failure or strained success (i.e., success states in which system/area/
